text:
National Public School, Rajajinagar, is in the dock for allegedly submitting fake certificates for minority status. Members of the National Commission for Minority Educational Institutions said a police complaint had been filed against the school in New Delhi on charges of forgery. “We found that last year and this year, they had submitted documents that turned out to be fake,” a member said.

Officials of the State’s Education Department said the commission had communicated the details to them and action would be taken against the school if the management did not admit students under the Right to Education quota the coming academic year.

When contacted, representatives of the school management refused to comment on the issue and said the investigations were ongoing.
title: FIR against NPS, New Delhi
